name: Yi He
title: Co-Founder & Chief Customer Service Officer
biography: Yi He is the Co-Founder of Binance. Since Binance's launch in 2017, Yi has led the business strategy, which saw the company successfully become the world’s largest crypto exchange within the span of six months. Yi also pivoted the company to a global blockchain ecosystem from just a crypto-to-crypto trading platform. Before co-founding Binance, Yi served as Vice President at Yixia Technology, the leading mobile video tech company behind popular mobile apps like Miaopai, Xiaokaxiu and Yizhibo, where she led branding strategy and marketing operations and was a fundamental part of the fundraising strategy that drove the firm’s valuation to USD$3+ billion. Yi was also co-founder of the digital asset exchange OKCoin between 2014 and 2015. Under her leadership at OKCoin, the company’s market share in China increased by 60% during a bear market to become the dominant digital asset exchange in Asia. Yi is passionate about providing transparency and empowering communities in the cryptocurrency industry and championing economic freedom. Throughout her successful leadership in crypto companies, Yi helped to create a trend of hiring female executives in the male-dominant tech industry and gained the crypto market’s trust in women leaders.

interview.zh: Yi He，您在Binance担任Co-Founder & Chief Customer Service Officer期间，哪一个项目或战略最能体现您当前的关注点？能与我们分享背后的关键洞察吗？

name: Richard Teng
title: CEO
biography: Richard Teng is an experienced executive with over three decades of financial services and regulatory experience. Richard has been the CEO of Binance since his appointment in November 2023. By working closely with various stakeholders including regulators, policymakers, industry players and users, Richard is furthering the growth of Binance in a compliant and sustainable manner. Prior to this role, Richard held various senior leadership roles within the company since joining in August 2021. Before joining Binance, Richard was CEO of the Financial Services Regulatory Authority at Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), where he showcased his capabilities as one of the world’s foremost innovative regulators. Richard’s vast experience also includes being the Chief Regulatory Officer of the Singapore Exchange (SGX) and the Director of Corporate Finance in the Monetary Authority of Singapore. Richard received his Masters in Applied Finance from the University of Western Australia.

title: Founder & Executive Chairman

He is also the founder of Alarm.com (ALRM), named inventor on 48+ patents, & author of the book “The Mobile Wave”. He founded the Saylor Academy (saylor.org), a non-profit that has provided free education to over 2 million students. He is an advocate for the Bitcoin Standard (hope.com) with dual degrees from MIT in Aerospace Engineering & History of Science. He posts his views on X @saylor and his website Michael.com. His 4 hour interview with Lex Fridman summarizes his thoughts on Bitcoin, Inflation, and the Future of Money with ~11 million views on YouTube.

title: Founder & CEO
biography: Sandeep Nailwal is the founder of Polygon and CEO of the Polygon Foundation, building infrastructure for a decentralized internet. He works with Marc Borion, CEO of Polygon Labs, to guide the protocol’s long-term growth. Nailwal began in blockchain with Bitcoin in 2013, later launching Polygon (originally Matic) in 2017 to scale Ethereum. Today, Polygon powers payments, RWAs, and Web3 adoption, with Agglayer as its next frontier. Beyond Polygon, Nailwal co-founded Sentient, launched Blockchain for Impact, and created the Nailwal Fellowship. He holds an MBA from NITIE.

name: Christian Angermayer
title: Founder
biography: Christian Angermayer is a serial entrepreneur and investor shaping the Next Human Agenda: a future where technology empowers people to live longer, healthier, and happier lives. He is the world’s leading advocate for the medical use of psychedelics and human enhancement, championing scientific progress to unlock the full physical and mental potential of humanity. His family office, Apeiron Investment Group, is driven by a bold optimism in technology’s power to enhance human life. Entrepreneurial at heart, Christian and Apeiron are hands-on, long-term partners - committed to supporting founders and emerging asset managers who push the boundaries of imagination and build the future we aspire to live in.With teams across New York, London, Berlin, Abu Dhabi, and Malta, Apeiron applies a global, multi-strategy investment approach with a primary focus on the United States. Apeiron invests directly in private and public companies, creates and launches new ventures of its own, anchors LP commitments, and takes minority GP stakes in emerging managers.Today, Apeiron manages approximately $7 billion of internal and external capital. With its proprietary balance sheet, Apeiron invests across the full company lifecycle — from incubating and accelerating breakthrough ideas, to scaling growth-stage businesses, to making transformative investments in listed companies.

Lily received a BA in Economics and International Relations from Stanford, and studied East Asian Studies at Harvard.

She has led multiple public sector projects and holds certifications in blockchain, cloud, and AI. Dr. Abeer earned her Ph.D. in Computer Science from King’s College London and an Executive Certificate in Digital Business from MIT Sloan School. She is an active member of global communities, including IEEE Blockchain, Blockchain Council, and Sigma Xi.

name: Alexia Hilbertidou
title: Founder & CEO
biography: Alexia Hilbertidou is the founder of GirlBoss New Zealand and GirlBoss UAE — a 17,500-strong movement of ambitious young women redefining leadership across New Zealand, the Pacific, and the Middle East.Her mission is simple: get more women to the table and equip the next generation with the confidence, digital fluency, and future-ready skills they need to lead. Alexia founded GirlBoss at just 16 years old from her bedroom. Today, the movement has reached young women across 27 countries. She has spoken at over 150 international schools, empowering more than 100,000 students to step into their potential. Through the GirlBoss Edge accelerator, over 5,000 youth-led social impact projects have been launched, bringing to life Alexia’s core message: you’re never too young to create change.Her global platform has taken her to the United Nations in New York and the World Economic Forum in Switzerland, where she has shared stages with leaders such as Sir Richard Branson and Meghan Markle.In Dubai, Alexia was appointed the Gender Equality Ambassador at World Expo 2020. She led ChangemakeHer, a flagship youth empowerment event co-hosted with Her Excellency Shamma Al Mazrui, UAE Minister of Youth, reaching over 600 students and earning praise for transforming youth leadership in the region.Her impact has been recognised with more than 30 international honours, including Forbes 30 Under 30 and Finalist for World Young Entrepreneur of the Year. A National Geographic Explorer and former VIP Scientific Communicator for NASA, Alexia is the host of an upcoming Disney+ documentary premiering in late 2025. At just 19, she joined the board of a 4.8 billion USD philanthropic investment fund, making her one of the youngest directors of its kind worldwide.Alexia was also awarded a Queen's Young Leader Award for Services to the Commonwealth by Her Majesty, The Queen, at Buckingham Palace. She was selected from over 20,000 nominations and is the youngest Commonwealth Citizen to hold this honour.She holds a Master’s in Emerging Technology and studied Leadership for Change at the University of Cambridge.

name: Avery Ching
title: Co-Founder & CEO
biography: Avery is the CEO and Co-Founder of Aptos Labs, the team that helped to launch the Aptos layer 1 blockchain. Avery spent over a decade leading teams at Meta, most recently as the Tech Lead of the crypto platform, which covered projects across general blockchain development and ecosystems, wallet infrastructure, strategy and most notably the Diem blockchain. Prior to that, Avery was the overall tech lead of all of Meta’s batch processing teams including Spark, Graph processing (Apache Giraph), Facebook Hive/Hadoop (Corona), distributed scheduling, and the unified programming model for pipelines. These technologies power analytics for all of Meta’s products and scale to hundreds of thousands of machines. Born and raised in Honolulu, Hawaii, Avery studied computer engineering at Northwestern University where he also received his PhD in Computer Engineering specializing in the area of supercomputing, parallel computing frameworks, and high-performance file systems.

biography: Balaji S. Srinivasan (@balajis) is the author of the Network State and founder of the Network School. Formerly the CTO of Coinbase and General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, he is an early investor in many successful tech companies, including Alchemy, Anduril, Benchling, Celestia, CoinTracker, Culdesac, Dapper Labs, Digital Ocean, Enhanced Games, Espresso Systems, Farcaster, Hadrian, Infinita, Instadapp, Luma, Minicircle, Mirror, Nucleus Genomics, Omada Health, OpenGov, OpenSea, Orchid Health, Paradigm, Perplexity, Polychain, Polymarket, Prospera, Replit, Republic, Starkware, Stedi, Superhuman, Synthesis, Varda, VoteAgora, and Zora, to name a few. Balaji also led the launch of USDC as Coinbase CTO, and was an early investor in many important crypto protocols including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, Avalanche, Chainlink, NEAR, Polygon, XMTP, and Zcash. Dr. Srinivasan was the cofounder of Earn.com (acquired by Coinbase), Counsyl (acquired by Myriad), Teleport (acquired by Topia), and Coin Center. name: Dan Murphy
title: Anchor & Correspondent
biography: Dan Murphy is CNBC’s Anchor and Correspondent in the United Arab Emirates, covering global business, markets, economics, and geopolitics from the heart of the Middle East. Dan is also the host of Access Middle East - CNBC’s flagship program from the region. The show is broadcast worldwide and features in-depth interviews with Heads of State, Finance Ministers, Central Bank Governors, sovereign wealth fund executives, and leading regional leaders and CEOs. Dan provides high-level insight into the Gulf’s rapidly evolving economic landscape, and the vast pools of capital driving transformation across the region. His field reporting spans major financial hubs and geopolitical hotspots - from anchoring live coverage in Saudi Arabia, the UAE, and Qatar to covering critical elections in Turkey and Israel, and delivering high-stakes interviews in Egypt and Russia. A leading voice in energy and geo-economics, Dan was awarded the 2023 GI International Energy Journalism Award for his reporting on global energy markets. He regularly reports from OPEC meetings in Vienna, and also serves as an Energy Journalism Fellow at Columbia’s Center of Global Energy Policy. Dan regularly reports from the World Economic Forum in Davos, Riyadh, and Dubai, and has led more than 100 high-level panels at global conferences and events focusing on the Middle East, finance, banking, energy, technology, aviation, and leadership in the Arab world. In 2024, Dan was named one of thirty-six Young Global Leaders by the Atlantic Council and selected for the prestigious Millennium Fellowship, which recognizes leaders shaping the future of international affairs. Dan began his career with CNBC in Singapore in 2015, and was part of the team that launched the network’s Gulf bureaus in Dubai and Abu Dhabi in 2018. Prior to CNBC, he reported for Sky News in Australia.

Gerry is deeply passionate about advancing decentralized finance, elevating user experience standards in Web3, and building products that empower global users with true ownership and financial freedom.

With over 500,000 LinkedIn followers, Henri is a global keynote speaker, a best-selling published author, and is regularly featured in global media outlets such as Bloomberg, CNBC, CNN, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, The Economist, and the Financial Times. He was named by LinkedIn as one of the Global Top Voices in Finance and hosts the Crypto Capsules™ social media video series, as well as The Future of Money podcast and newsletter. Henri is the author of three best-selling crypto-related books including "The Book of Crypto" (Palgrave, 2022), "The Future of Finance" (Palgrave, 2019) and his recent children's book "Decoding Crypto with Henri & Hodler" (Brown Books Kids, 2024) Onalytica recognized Henri as the #1 most influential individual in Finance globally on LinkedIn, out of over 50,000 individuals working at top professional services and management consulting firms worldwide. Chambers Global named Henri the "highest profile FinTech consultant in Hong Kong." Blockchain Asset Review recognized him as the "Most Influential Crypto and Blockchain Thought Leader in Asia," and Asian Private Banker awarded him the "FinTech Changemaker of the Year" award. Henri was elected as the first Chairman of the FinTech Association of Hong Kong and appointed by the Hong Kong High Court as a court-appointed expert in FinTech litigation matters. Henri began his career as a financial markets and funds lawyer in Canada and Hong Kong before joining UBS Investment Bank's prime brokerage capital consulting team. name: Jacob Hanna
title: Co-Founder and Chief Scientific Advisor
biography: Prof. Jacob (Yaqub) Hanna earned his BSc in medical science (2001), PhD in immunology (2007), and MD in clinical medicine summa cum laude (2007) from the Hebrew University. He conducted postdoctoral research at MIT. He joined the department of Molecular Genetics at the Weizmann Institute in 2011.Prof. Hanna is pioneering techniques in induced naïve pluripotency from adult cell and synthetic whole embryo-like developmental models made solely from stem cells ex utero for regenerating new organs and tissues. Induced pluripotent stem (iPS) cells have regenerative properties almost identical to those of embryonic stem cells but can be created from adult cells without using an egg or fetal material. Prof. Hanna has uncovered novel pathways regulating the reprogramming process and was the first to derive pristine “naïve” human pluripotent cells equivalent to those derived from mice and (i) can generate “cross-species humanized chimeric” mouse models that have human derived tissues (ii) can give rise to human primordial germ cell (progenitors of egg or sperm) or (iii) to all extra-embryonic compartments (placenta and yolk-sac). He was the first to expand prolonged periods of advanced and normal mammalian embryo development from pre-gastrulation until late organogenesis in an “artificial uterus” environment outside the maternal womb. The latter platform enabled him to demonstrate the ability to be the first to generate advanced stage & whole stem cell derived developmental models made entirely from naïve pluripotent stem cells in the petri dish in mice and human. He was awarded the Sir Charles Clore Prize (2011), a Rappaport Prize in biomedical research (2013), Krill Prize by the Wolf Foundation (2013), and the Helen and Martin Kimmel Award (2014). In 2014, he was featured among “40 under 40” innovative scientists by Cell journal and became EMBO member in 2018. In 2021, he ranked at the top of the list of 50 leading world thinkers by Prospect magazine. In 2025 he received the Nakasone award by the Human Frontiers Science Program for his groundbreaking work on naïve stem cell derived high fidelity embryo models.

title: Founder & CEO
biography: Nikita Sachdev is an American entrepreneur and a prominent voice in the global blockchain and Web3 space. With academic foundations in Chemistry and Business from the University of Texas at Austin and James Cook University, Nikita launched her first venture, Luna Management, in Singapore in 2015 - a talent and production agency that became her gateway into crypto. Her early work with Huobi (now HTX) in 2017, where she interviewed blockchain pioneers, sparked her deep involvement in the industry. Following a successful exit from Luna Management, she founded Luna PR in 2019. Today, the multi-award-winning, multi-million-dollar agency is globally recognized for its contributions to the Web3 and emerging tech sectors. With a team of over 75 specialists and offices across four continents, Luna PR has worked with more than 600 clients, from ambitious startups to government institutions - delivering strategic communications, media visibility, and growth support.‍Nikita co-produced and hosted On the Chain, CNBC Arabia’s first Web3-focused television show, reaching over 50 million homes across the Middle East. As a member of the Forbes Business Council and a sought-after speaker at leading conferences and universities, Nikita continues to shape the conversation around blockchain adoption. Named one of Arabian Business’s 50 Inspiring Women Leaders, her mission is to bridge the gap between innovation and mainstream understanding, bringing Web3 to the world through powerful storytelling and strategic media.

name: Reeve Collins
title: Co-Founder & Chairman
biography: Reeve Collins is a pioneer in blockchain, stablecoins, and digital assets, with a legacy of creating category-defining innovations. After co-founding Tether, the world’s first stablecoin, and launching the first platform for NFTs, he helped shape two of the most transformative movements in Web3. Today, Reeve is driving the Money-as-a-Service (MaaS) revolution through STBL, introducing Stablecoin 2.0, a new model where stability becomes productive and the network, not intermediaries, captures the economic value. Through STBL, he is enabling institutions, enterprises, and ecosystems to launch tailored stablecoins, unlocking programmable money designed for scale, transparency, and real-world adoption. He is also the Co-Founder of WeFi, a Deobank bridging DeFi with payments and financial inclusion, and the incoming Chairman of ReserveOne, a publicly traded digital asset treasury providing seamless public market access to Bitcoin, altcoins, and DeFi yield. With over two decades of building and scaling breakthrough ventures, Reeve is committed to delivering on the original promise of Web3 by creating open, resilient, and accessible financial systems. His mission is to reshape global markets through tokenized real-world assets and Stablecoin 2.0, empowering a future where money itself becomes an engine of opportunity.

biography: Ryan Kim is a Co-founder and Partner at Hashed, a global venture fund dedicated to accelerating the adoption of blockchain and Web3 technologies. Based in Singapore, he leads investments in Infrastructure, DeFi, Gaming, and Entertainment, working closely with visionary founders to connect them with global networks and resources. Hashed operates from offices in Seoul, Singapore, Silicon Valley, and Abu Dhabi, giving Ryan a strategic vantage point to drive cross-border collaboration and unlock opportunities across diverse markets. At LOOKET, he led the development and planning of recommendation systems, an experience that deepened his understanding of data challenges and sparked his passion for blockchain technology. Formerly at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, she designed and now leads BakerHostetler’s Digital and Innovative Markets team and co-leads its Web3 and Digitas Assets practice. She combines deep experience in securities law, corporate governance, and market structure with forward-looking expertise in digital assets and decentralized finance. Teresa advises global industry participants, governments, and regulators on how to navigate blockchain’s rapidly evolving legal landscape and seamlessly integrate crypto markets and traditional financial markets. Teresa has extensive experience in securities, litigation, investigations, and corporate matters, including across blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, AI, and Web3 ecosystems. She has served as trusted counsel to high-stakes market participants in civil litigation, regulatory enforcement matters, and corporate transactions. Ranked by Chambers for Blockchain & Cryptocurrencies and named to the SEC “Enforcement Elite”, she has authored influential thought leadership on securities law and economic theory, developed a Modular Economic Abstraction regulatory framework as applied to digital assets, and is recognized for bridging the gap between legal frameworks and innovative technologies. With an MBA, Certified Fraud Examiner, and Cryptocurrency Tracing Certified Examiner credentials, she brings both legal precision and business acumen to guide leaders through uncharted waters. Teresa brings her unique perspective as both a regulatory insider and a formidable advocate for modernized markets that empower innovators while protecting investors.

biography: Co-Founder, Basketball.fun | , Chief Digital Equity Officer World MobileTristan Thompson is a championship-winning athlete, entrepreneur, and emerging voice at the intersection of sports, culture, and Web3. After more than a decade in the NBA, he’s shifted his focus to building the future of digital fan engagement and athlete empowerment through technology.As Co-Founder and Lead Advisor at Basketball.fun (TEASER HERE) , Tristan is reimagining what it means to be a fan. The platform gives people the chance to own NBA moments, make live predictions, and build their fan identity through tokenized player shares and clubs, turning the energy of game night into a participatory, on-chain experience. Built on Somnia’s blockchain, Basketball.fun is fast, gasless, and simple enough for anyone to use. It bridges sports, culture, and community while using stablecoins to make rewards instant, global, and real.Beyond sports innovation, Tristan serves as Chief Advisory Officer at AxonDAO, where he’s helping redefine how people control and monetize their health and bio-data. He’s also partnered with World Mobile, a decentralized project focused on expanding internet access.Tristan’s thought leadership has been featured in Forbes, Yahoo Finance , CoinDesk, Cointelegraph, Decrypt, The Block, and on CNBC Crypto World, The Street, Fox News, Thinking Crypto, and CoinMarketCap Live, where he was the first athlete ever featured. His high-profile interviews, including with Bo Hines, reflect his growing influence across sports, crypto, and technology.He recently spoke at Korea Blockchain Week, where he discussed athlete empowerment and decentralized fandom, and is set to appear next at Binance Blockchain Week and Bitcoin MENA, continuing to champion the conversation around Web3 adoption and digital ownership.Thought leadership Op-Eds penned by Tristan:Newsweek: NBA Champion Tristan Thompson: ‘AI is the Ultimate Teammate’Entrepreneur: How Building Tech With No Tech Background Taught Me the Most Valuable Skill in BusinessCointelegraph: Blockchain is the missing trust layer in sports analytics

name: Yasar Yilmaz
title: Global Industry Director, FSI
biography: Yasar is an Industry Director in Microsoft’s Worldwide Financial Services leadership team, where he helps shape the future of financial services. With 27 years of experience driving digital transformation across Turkey, Eastern Europe, Middle East, and Africa, he’s worked shoulder-to-shoulder with top financial institutions to turn bold ideas into real business outcomes.Part strategist, part innovator, Yasar is a design thinking pro, AI visionary and a blockchain believer. He’s led game-changing projects at PwC, Oracle, SunGard-FIS, Capgemini, and SAP—always focused on helping C-level leaders unlock value, reinvent business models, and rethink what’s possible.His mission? To turn complexity into clarity and strategy into action—fast.
